Address.college_name: Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zürich

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1855
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitätszeugnis) or recognized equivalent, or entrance examination

Address.college_name: University of Bern

GeneralInformation.History: The University of Bern has roots dating back to the 16th century and was officially transformed into a university in 1834. The University of Bern stands for excellence in teaching and research across the entire institution. Its comprehensive study programs range from the sciences to the humanities and beyond. With many internationally acclaimed research strengths, highlights include climate science, space, medicine and sustainable development
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school leaving certificate (Maturitätszeugnis) or equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Fribourg

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1889, the University of Fribourg encompasses five faculties where people study, teach and research: Arts and Humanities; Law; Management, Economics and Social Sciences; Science and Medicine; and Theology. As the only bilingual university in Switzerland, the University of Fribourg offers a wide range of courses of study in French, German or both. A number of courses with an international aspect are also offered in English. The members of our University community come from 110 countries and make Fribourg, with its 40,000 inhabitants, a university town “par excellence”
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (baccalauréat or maturité fédérale) or recognized foreign equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Geneva

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1559 as Schola Genevensis by Calvin, established as university 1873. Under the supervision of the Department of Public Education and financed by the State
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to June (September - December; February - June)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturité/ baccalauréat) or equivalent

Divisions.College: Bioethics and Social Sciences in Medicine

Divisions.Details: called in French: Faculté des Lettres
ISMMS - Part of the Faculty of Medicine
ELCF - Part of the Faculty of Humanities

Address.college_name: University of Lausanne

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1537 as the Académie de Lausanne, a theological seminary. Received the status of a University in 1890. The University is an independent public institution under the control of the Cantonal authorities.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to July (autumn semester: September-February; spring semester: February-July)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (baccalauréat, maturité) or a qualification recognized as equivalent

Divisions.College: Law, Criminal Justice and Public Administration

Divisions.Details: Founded in 1981, the IDHEAP has been integrated into the University of Lausanne in 2014. It is dedicated to the public and parapublic sector. https://www.unil.ch/idheap

Address.college_name: University of Lucerne

GeneralInformation.History: Roots going back to 1574. Founded in 2000. Acquired present status and title in 2005
AdmissionRequirements: upper secondary school-leaving certificates or foreign equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Neuchâtel

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1838 as Academy, became University 1909. Under the responsibility of the Cantonal authorities.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Baccalauréat or Maturité) or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: Bern University of Applied Sciences
Address.university_name: Berner Fachhochschule – Haute école spécialisée bernoise (BFH)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1802. Acquired present status 2003

Divisions.College: Design, Music, Theatre and other Arts

Address.college_name: Eastern Switzerland University of Applied Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: The three universities of Applied sciences in the canton of St.Gallen - FHS St.Gallen, HSR Rapperswil and NTB Buchs - merged on September 1, 2020 to form the OST - Eastern Switzerland University of Applied Sciences. OST is the university of applied sciences for the six cantons of Eastern Switzerland and the Principality of Liechtenstein

Divisions.Details: HSR Rapperswil; NTB Buchs and HTW Chur

Address.college_name: Franklin University Switzerland

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1969

Address.Street:
Case postale 1672
Maison de la paix, Rue Eugène-Rigot 2
Address.college_name: Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies
Address.university_name: Institut de hautes études internationales et du développement – The Graduate Institute, Geneva

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1927 at the heyday of the League of Nations, when it became the first institution in the world entirely dedicated to the study of international affairs. An independent organization established as a private foundation, the Graduate Institute receives funding from the Swiss federal state and the state of Geneva. Acquired present status 2008
AdmissionRequirements: Bachelor's level degree for admission to Master programmes
Certified English proficiency test
GRE scores required for the MIS Master and PhD programmes specialising in Economics

Address.college_name: Kalaidos University of Applied Sciences Switzerland

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2005. Department of Health founded 2006. Department of Music founded 2010

Divisions.Details: Kalaidos Fachhochschule Wirtschaft and PHW Bern

Address.college_name: Lucerne University of Applied Sciences and Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1997 as Fachhochschule Zentralschweiz. Acquired present title and status 2007
AdmissionRequirements: A professional maturity, the matura or equivalent, or an entrance examination leading to a bachelor's degree program at the University of Lucerne
Some degree programs require specific qualifications or experience

Divisions.Details: Lucerne School of Art and Design

Address.college_name: SBS Swiss Business School

GeneralInformation.History: Created 1998
AdmissionRequirements: High School or IB diploma for Bachelor degree; Bachelor degree for Master programs; MBA degree for Doctoral programs

Address.college_name: University of Applied Sciences and Arts Northwestern Switzerland

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2006 from the merger of three Universities of Applied Sciences (Aargau, Basel-Stadt and Basel-Land, and Solothurn), the School of Education of Solothurn and the School of Education and Social Sciences of Basel-Stadt and Basel-Land

Divisions.Details: Hochschule für Gestaltung und Kunst, Basel
Musikakademie Hochschule für Musik Basel und Schola Cantorum Basiliensis

Address.college_name: University of Applied Sciences and Arts of Southern Switzerland
Address.university_name: Scuola universitaria professionale della Svizzera italiana (SUPSI)

GeneralInformation.History: Created 1997
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to December; February to May
AdmissionRequirements: Upper secondary education: either an apprenticeship with a professional maturity certificate (maturità professionale); or a general (academic) maturity certificate (maturità liceale), plus one year of professional practice in the form of an internship or work placement
In some subjects (social work, health, art or music) applicants must pass an entrance examination
Candidates over 25 and who can demonstrate significant training and experience in a field related to the degree course may also be admitted

Divisions.Details: Dipartimento Ambiente, Costruzioni e Design, Canobbio

Address.college_name: University of Applied Sciences and Arts Western Switzerland
Address.university_name: Haute Ecole spécialisée de Suisse Occidentale – Fachhochschule Westscwheiz (HES-SO)

GeneralInformation.History: An Interregional institution founded 1998 by an agreement between the states of Geneva, Vaud, Fribourg, Valais, Neuchâtel, Jura and Bern (french-part). Integrated the Valais School of Design and Arts (EDHEA) as one of its five schools 2019
AdmissionRequirements: Maturité and one year of professional experience

Divisions.Details: Haute école d'arts appliqués (Arc), La Chaux-de-Fonds; Haute école d'art et de design, Lausanne (ECAL) et Haute école d'arts et de design, Genève
Haute école de musique de Genève et Haute école de musique de Lausanne

Address.college_name: University of Applied Sciences in Special Needs Education

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1924. Transformed into the University of Applied Sciences of Special Needs Education in 2001
AdmissionRequirements: Teaching Diploma, High-school diploma, Diploma or Bachelor's degree from a University of Applied Sciences
Entrance examination

Address.college_name: University of Applied Sciences of the Grisons

Address.college_name: University of Basel

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1460 under the authority of Papal Bull of Pius II. Under the jurisdiction of the Canton of Basle 1830. Became autonomous 1996

Address.college_name: University of Lugano

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1996. Acquired Status 2000
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school leaving certificate (Maturitätszeugnis) or equivalent

Address.college_name: University of St. Gallen

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1898. An autonomous Institution mainly financed by the Canton of Saint Gall and by the Swiss Confederation
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitätszeugnis), or foreign equivalent and entrance examination

Address.college_name: University of Teacher Education - Bern, Jura and Neuchâtel
Address.university_name: Haute Ecole Pédagogique des cantons de Berne, du Jura et de Neuchâtel – Haute Ecole Pédagogique - BEJUNE (HEP-BEJUNE)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded by cantons of Bern, Jura and Neuchâtel in 2000 in order to replace previous teacher schools that did not have a university status
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: From August to July (Automn Semester: August to January, Spring Semester: February to July)
AdmissionRequirements:
For pre-primary and primary education : Secondary school certificate (maturité, baccalauraét) or equivalent
For secondary education : Bachelor of Arts or of Science
For higher secondary education : Master of Arts or of Science
For special needs education : Bachelor of Arts in Pre-Primary and Primary Education or Master of Arts or of Science in Secondary Education and/or Higher Education

Address.college_name: University of Teacher Education - Valais
Address.university_name: Pädagogische Hochschule Wallis - Haute école pédagogique du Valais (PH VS / HEP VS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2001
AdmissionRequirements: Gymnasiale Maturas or equivalent, University of Applied Science Degreer, Certificat in Health and Pedagogy or Pedagogy Maturas

Address.college_name: University of Teacher Education - Vaud
Address.university_name: Haute Ecole Pédagogique du canton de Vaud (HEP Vaud)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 2001. Following the new Act of 2007, the University of Teacher Education (HEP Vaud) is an independent public institution under the control of the cantonal authorities
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to July (autumn semester : August-January; spring semester : February-July)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (maturité, baccalauréat) or equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Zurich

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1833. The first University founded by a liberal democratic state without ecclesiastical or royal patronage. Given extensive autonomy 1998
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitätszeugnis) or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: Economics, Business Administration and Information Technology

Divisions.Details: Joint faculty with Universities of Zurich and Berne
